headline: A process is a smart contract deployed on AO
definition: Processes hold state, receive messages, and have functions to handle different interactions.

headline: The Permaweb is a decentralized and immutable web built on top of Arweave
definition: The Permaweb refers to web applications and dApps built on AO and Arweave, accessible just like the normal web - but immutable and long-lasting.

headline: Messages are how processes on AO communicate
definition: Every interaction with a process on AO is sent as a message - each one verifiable, and stored as a transaction on Arweave.

headline: AO uses handlers to respond to different types of interactions (messages)
definition: Processes on AO contain handlers, which are functions written to "handle" different types of interactions.

headline: AO processes are deployed using an Arweave wallet
definition: An Arweave wallet is a crypto wallet which stores and holds $AR tokens. A wallet can be used to deploy AO processes, and upload data to Arweave.

headline: AOS is a system used to interact with AO
definition: Developers can use AOS to deploy, execute, and interact with processes on AO. It includes common Lua modules to get started building processes.

headline: Arweave is the storage layer powering AO
definition: Every single AO process and message is stored and read from Arweave. It acts as the state layer for each process, while AO nodes read from it and perform computation.

headline: Lua is the programming language used for AO processes
definition: Lua is a dynamically-typed, lightweight programming language used to write processes on AO.

headline: Browser extension and mobile wallet for Arweave and AO
definition: Wander is a non-custodial Arweave and AO native wallet with extensive features. It's available as a browser extension and mobile app.
